title: proposal: Add an x/media package
body:
# The Proposal
Golang has an `x/image` "extension" library. Adding an `x/media` package for parsing video and audio transports (and possibly codecs) seems a logical extension. Interacting with media is an extremely common task today, having this as part of the standard library would probably be beneficial for all.

# Proposed Implementation
We at Comcast have recently open sourced our [aac parser](https://github.com/Comcast/gaad). We also are looking to open source our parsers for h.264, h.265, DD, DD+, and MPEG2-TS. We would like to work with the go community to make them available in a golang extensions package. These parsers are currently only for the framing and transports, not the actual decoding.

## Similar Items
It appears the `x/image` has some ability to deal with the vp8 codec, but doesn't appear to deal with framing of any sort.
